item.title: For patients with disabilities, this doctor prioritizes independence — and fun
item.description: Sometimes health care means being able to go out and watch a wrestling match, according to Dr. Clarissa Kripke. She's pioneering a new kind of care for people with disabilities.

item.title: How do we halt the next pandemic? Be kind to critters like bats, says a new paper
item.description: A team of scientists argue that new vaccines and treatments wouldn't be critical if humans could figure out how to stop viruses from spilling over from animals in the first place.

item.title: Meta is limiting how much political content users see. Here's how to opt out of that
item.description: Meta is now limiting the amount of political content it recommends to Instagram and Threads users. Here's why it made the change — and how to opt out of it.

item.title: With war in Gaza, Israel faces new pressure to draft the ultra-Orthodox into service
item.description: Religious scholars have broad exemption from military service. But critics say that's no longer sustainable, given their fast-growing population and the war in Gaza.

item.title: Trump has embraced Jan. 6. The extremist message may alienate — or resonate
item.description: He praises defendants who are charged with rioting that day. His campaign's launch site has connections to extremist violence. Experts worry he's tapping into anger that motivated domestic terrorism.

item.description: After Kathryn Fumie burned her face in a kitchen accident, the EMT on the ride to the hospital helped her feel like everything was going to be OK.

item.title: She reads the newspaper on TikTok — and her videos are going viral
item.description: Newspapers are losing the battle against smartphones as the place to learn the news, but one woman has found a way to bridge the divide and bring the print to the people.

item.title: A Supreme Court abortion pill case with potential consequences for every other drug
item.description: At issue is the FDA's regulatory power to approve drugs and continually evaluate their safety — a system that until now has been widely viewed as the gold standard for both safety and innovation

item.title: The Francis Scott Key bridge in Baltimore collapses after a ship crashed into it
item.description: A part of a Baltimore bridge serving as a vital highway artery and an East Coast shipping hub collapsed early Tuesday morning after a container ship crashed into it, sending people into the water.

item.title: What is the new etiquette for tipping?
item.description: Tipping requests are on the rise. Businesses that never seemed to ask for a tip, like fast food joints, are now asking for one. Here's how to deal with unexpected requests and more.
